gen_csh_gx_cat module

Contains Cython functions to generate central subhalo (CSH) and galaxy catalogues from HDF5 Gadget-type output

Created on Mon Mar 28 12:24:04 2022

gen_csh_gx_cat.createGxs(float[:] star_xyz, float[:, :] fof_com, int[:] nb_shs, float[:, :] sh_com, float L_BOX)[source]

Find closest FoF-halo for star particle at position star_xyz

Parameters

  • star_xyz ((3,) float) – position of star particle

  • fof_com ((N1, 3) floats) – COMs of FoF-halos

  • nb_shs ((N1,) ints) – number of SHs in each FoF-halo

  • sh_com ((N2, 3) floats) – COMs of the SHs

  • L_BOX (float) – side length of simulation box, in cMpc/h

Returns

index of FoF-halo to which star particle is closest, -1 if star particle is to be discarded (since closer to some SH other than the CSH)

Return type

int

gen_csh_gx_cat.getCSHCat(int[:] nb_shs, int[:] sh_len, int[:] fof_dm_sizes, float[:] group_r200, float[:] halo_masses, int MIN_NUMBER_DM_PTCS)[source]

Construct central subhalo (CSH) catalogue from FoF/SH info

Note that the indices returned in each CSH are ‘true index + 1’

Parameters

  • nb_shs ((N1,) ints) – number of SHs in each FoF-halo

  • fof_dm_size ((N1,) ints) – number of particles in the FoF-halos

  • group_r200 ((N1,) floats) – R200-radius of FoF-halos

  • halo_masses ((N1,) floats) – masses of FoF-halos

  • MIN_NUMBER_DM_PTCS (int) – minimum number of DM particles for CSH to be valid

Returns

h_cat: indices (+1, to allow 0 to be interpreted as no index), h_r200: R200-radii, h_pass: passed MIN_NUMBER_DM_PTCS-threshold or not

Return type

int array, float array, int array

gen_csh_gx_cat.getCSHIdxs(int[:] h_idxs, int start_idx, int fof_dm_size, int nb_shs, int csh_size, int MIN_NUMBER_DM_PTCS)[source]

Return the indices of the DM particles that belong to the CSH

Parameters

  • h_idxs (int array) – array to store the indices

  • start_idx (int) – first index that belongs to this CSH

  • fof_dm_size ((N1,) ints) – number of particles in the FoF-halos

  • nb_shs ((N1,) ints) – number of SHs in each FoF-halo

  • csh_size ((N2,) ints) – number of particles in the SHs

  • MIN_NUMBER_DM_PTCS (int) – minimum number of DM particles for CSH to be valid

Returns

h_idxs filled partially with indices (+1, to allow 0 to be interpreted as no index)

Return type

int array

gen_csh_gx_cat.getGxCat(float[:, :] star_xyz, float[:, :] fof_com, int[:] nb_shs, float[:, :] sh_com, float L_BOX, int MIN_NUMBER_STAR_PTCS)[source]

Construct galaxy catalogue

The approach is very simple: Assign each star particle to its nearest FoF-halo, and bundle the star particles into newly obtained ‘galaxies’. If the star particle is closer to a subhalo (SH) that is not the central subhalo (CSH), discard the star particle.

Parameters

  • star_xyz ((N, 3,) floats) – position of star particles

  • fof_com ((N1, 3) floats) – COMs of FoF-halos

  • nb_shs ((N1,) ints) – number of SHs in each FoF-halo

  • sh_com ((N2, 3) floats) – COMs of the SHs

  • L_BOX (float) – side length of simulation box, in cMpc/h

  • MIN_NUMBER_STAR_PTCS (int) – minimum number of star particles for galaxy to be valid

Returns

galaxy catalogue, containing indices of star particles belong to each galaxy

Return type

list of N1 int lists containing indices
